name: Creating a Ticket for Customer Support Team Based on Sales Orders
title: Creating a Ticket for Customer Support Team Based on Sales Orders
body:
Overview

This guide outlines the necessary information sales teams should provide when creating a ticket for customer support. The information varies depending on the type of order: Installation, Account Creation, Module/Addons, or Service Orders. Providing complete and accurate details ensures efficient processing and minimizes delays.

 

Information

This guide provides information about the essential steps and detailed information required to create a ticket for customer support based on various sales order types. 

 

Order Details

  • If existing customer: Please provide instance URL
  • Type of Order: Specify each category and provide the detailed requirements accordingly.
      • Installation Orders
      • Account Creation Orders
      • Module/Addons Orders
      • Service Orders

Installation Orders

  • Installation Type: (Options: New installation, Clone [e.g., for testing or migration], Mirror [for data recovery])
  • Hosting Preferences: (Options: AWS DE [Datacenter Germany], AWS US [Datacenter USA], Datagroup [with specific permissions])
  • Modules Required: (Options: Leadership, Employee, Panel/People, DataVoyager, Orbit, etc.)
  • Addons Needed: (Options: SSL certificates, Domain registrations, etc.)
  • Time Zone Setting: (List all available options, e.g., UTC, GMT+1, CST, etc.)

Account Creation Orders

  • Customer Type: (Options: New customer, Existing customer)
  • Account Type: (Options: Admin account, Trial account, Training account, Reporting account, Filemanager account, etc.)
  • Number of Accounts: (Specify the number of accounts needed)
  • Account Expiry: (Specify date or select 'No expiry')

Module/Addons Orders

  • Module/Addon Names: (Specify each module or addon, e.g., Employee, Leadership, DataVoyager)
  • Configuration Details: (Provide specifics such as any setup or configuration required, e.g., API access needs, interface customizations)

Service Orders

  • Service Type: (Options: Custom Programming [specify the project scope], Consulting [areas of focus], Cronjobs [specify execution schedule])
  • Details of Requirement: (Provide a comprehensive description of the services required, including objectives and expected outcomes)
  • Additional Information:
  • Ticket ID: [If applicable, provide the Jira/ZD case ID]
  • Project ID: [Enter the Project ID for reference]
  • Additional Comments: [Include any further details or special instructions that might aid in processing the order]

Summary:

When creating a ticket for customer support, sales teams must provide comprehensive information tailored to the specific order type. This ensures prompt and accurate handling of requests, reducing processing time and improving customer satisfaction.

 

FAQ

What should I do if I don’t have the instance URL for an existing customer?

You should retrieve the instance URL from the customer’s previous records or contact the customer to obtain it.

Can I specify multiple modules and addons in a single order?

Yes, you can list all required modules and addons under the respective section in the order details.

What if the customer needs a service not listed under the 'Service Orders' options?

Provide a detailed description of the required service for custom handling under 'Details of Requirement'.
